Authors_info: Bertrand Arthur William Russell, 3rd Earl Russell,  (; 18 May 1872 – 2 February 1970) was a British philosopher, logician, mathematician, historian, writer, social critic, political activist, and Nobel laureate.

Quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
Author: Xun Kuang
Authors_info: Xun Kuang (; Chinese: 荀況; pinyin: Xún Kuàng [ɕy̌n kʰwâŋ]; c. 310 – c. 235 BC, alt. c. 314 – c. 217 BC), also widely known as Xunzi (; Chinese: 荀子; pinyin: Xúnzǐ; Wade–Giles: Hsün-tzu, "Master Xun"), was a Chinese Confucian philosopher who lived during the Warring States period and contributed to the Hundred Schools of Thought.

Quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
Author: Walt Disney
Authors_info: The Walt Disney World Resort, also called Walt Disney World and Disney World, is an entertainment complex in Bay Lake and Lake Buena Vista, Florida, in the United States, near the cities Orlando and Kissimmee.

Quote: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
Author: Frederick Douglass
Authors_info: Frederick Douglass (born Frederick Augustus Washington Bailey; c. February 1818 – February 20, 1895) was an American social reformer, abolitionist, orator, writer, and statesman.

Quote: Our worst days are never so bad that you are beyond the reach of God's grace. And your best days are never so good that you are beyond the need of God's grace.
Author: Jerry Bridges
Authors_info: Jerry Bridges (December 4, 1929 – March 6, 2016) was an  evangelical Christian author, speaker and staff member of  The Navigators.

Quote: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
Author: J. R. R. Tolkien
Authors_info: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien,  (, ROOL TOL-keen; 3 January 1892 – 2 September 1973) was an English writer, poet, philologist, and university professor who is best known as the author of the classic high fantasy works The Hobbit, The Lord of the Rings, and The Silmarillion.

Quote: Whoever would overthrow the liberty of a nation must begin by subduing the freeness of speech.
Author: Benjamin Franklin
Authors_info: Benjamin Franklin  (January 17, 1706 [O.S. January 6, 1705] –  April 17, 1790) was an American polymath and one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.

Quote: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
Author: David Frost
Authors_info: Sir David Paradine Frost  (7 April 1939 – 31 August 2013) was an English television host, media personality, journalist, comedian, and writer.

Quote: Nothing will work unless you do.
Author: Maya Angelou
Authors_info: Maya Angelou ( (listen); born Marguerite Annie Johnson; April 4, 1928 – May 28, 2014) was an American poet, singer, memoirist, and civil rights activist.

Quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
Author: Winston Churchill
Authors_info: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill  (30 November 1874 – 24 January 1965) was a British politician, army officer, and writer, who was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1940 to 1945 and again from 1951 to 1955. Quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
Author: Mother Teresa
Authors_info: Mary Teresa Bojaxhiu commonly called Mother Teresa, and known in the Roman Catholic Church as Saint Teresa of Calcutta (born Anjezë Gonxhe Bojaxhiu, Albanian: [aˈɲɛzə ˈɡɔndʒɛ bɔjaˈdʒiu]; 26 August 1910 – 5 September 1997), was an Albanian-Indian Roman Catholic nun and missionary.

Quote: Love yourself. It is important to stay positive because beauty comes from the inside out.
Author: Jenn Proske
Authors_info: Jennifer Proske (born August 8, 1987) is a Canadian American actress, best known for portraying Becca Crane in the film Vampires Suck.

Quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
Author: Colin Powell
Authors_info: Colin Luther Powell (; born April 5, 1937) is an American statesman and a retired four-star general in the United States Army.

Quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
Author: Mother Teresa
Authors_info: Mary Teresa Bojaxhiu commonly called Mother Teresa, and known in the Roman Catholic Church as Saint Teresa of Calcutta (born Anjezë Gonxhe Bojaxhiu, Albanian: [aˈɲɛzə ˈɡɔndʒɛ bɔjaˈdʒiu]; 26 August 1910 – 5 September 1997), was an Albanian-Indian Roman Catholic nun and missionary.

Quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Born in Atlanta, King is best known for advancing civil rights through nonviolence and civil disobedience, tactics his Christian beliefs and the nonviolent activism of Mahatma Gandhi helped inspire.

Quote: There is no greater happiness for a man than approaching a door at the end of a day knowing someone on the other side of that door is waiting for the sound of his footsteps.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Prior to his presidency, he was a Hollywood actor and union leader before serving as the 33rd governor of California from 1967 to 1975.

Quote: Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.
Author: Milton Friedman

Quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
Author: Confucius
Authors_info: Confucius ( kən-FEW-shəs; 551–479 BC) was a Chinese teacher, editor, politician, and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn period of Chinese history.

Quote: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on.
Author: Nicholas Sparks
Authors_info: Nicholas Charles Sparks (born December 31, 1965) is an American romance novelist and screenwriter. He has published twenty novels and two non-fiction books.

Quote: An intelligent hell would be better than a stupid paradise.
Author: Victor Hugo
Authors_info: Victor Marie Hugo (French: [viktɔʁ maʁi yɡo] (listen); 26 February 1802 – 22 May 1885) was a French poet, novelist, and dramatist of the Romantic movement.

Quote: Run when you can, walk if you have to, crawl if you must; just never give up.
Author: Dean Karnazes
Authors_info: Dean Karnazes (English:  car-NEH-zis; born Constantine Karnazes; August 23, 1962), is an American ultramarathon runner, and author of Ultramarathon Man: Confessions of an All-Night Runner, which details ultra endurance running for the general public.

Quote: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin, but by the content of their character.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Never worry about numbers. Help one person at a time and always start with the person nearest you.

Quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: You are responsible for your life. You can't keep blaming somebody else for your dysfunction. Life is really about moving on.
Author: Oprah Winfrey
Authors_info: Oprah Winfrey (born  Orpah Gail Winfrey; January 29, 1954) is an American media executive, actress, talk show host, television producer and philanthropist.

Quote: Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve.
Author: Mary Kay Ash
Authors_info: Mary Kay Ash (May 12, 1918 – November 22, 2001) was an American businesswoman and founder of Mary Kay Cosmetics, Inc.

Quote: I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country.
Author: Nathan Hale
Authors_info: Nathan Hale (June 6, 1755 – September 22, 1776) was an American soldier and spy for the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War.

Quote: When we lose one blessing, another is often most unexpectedly given in its place.
Author: C. S. Lewis

Quote: Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.

Quote: The greatest enemy to human souls is the self-righteous spirit which makes men look to themselves for salvation.
Author: Charles Spurgeon
Authors_info: Charles Haddon Spurgeon (19 June 1834 – 31 January 1892) was an English Particular Baptist preacher. Spurgeon remains highly influential among Christians of various denominations, among whom he is known as the "Prince of Preachers".

Quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
Author: Dalai Lama
Authors_info: Dalai Lama (UK: , US: ; Standard Tibetan: ཏཱ་ལའི་བླ་མ་, Tā la'i bla ma [táːlɛː láma]) is a title given by the Tibetan people for the foremost spiritual leader of the Gelug or "Yellow Hat" school of Tibetan Buddhism, the newest of the classical schools of Tibetan Buddhism.

Quote: With God in charge, I believe everything will work out for the best in the end.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: The Marines I have seen around the world have the cleanest bodies, the filthiest minds, the highest morale, and the lowest morals of any group of animals I have ever seen. Thank God for the United States Marine Corps!
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.

Quote: Luck is predictable; the harder you work, the luckier you get.

Quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
Author: David Brinkley
Authors_info: David McClure Brinkley (July 10, 1920 – June 11, 2003) was an American newscaster for NBC and ABC in a career lasting from 1943 to 1997.

Quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quote: There is no substitute for hard work.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Author: Carol Burnett

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Authors_info: Oprah Winfrey (born  Orpah Gail Winfrey; January 29, 1954) is an American media executive, actress, talk show host, television producer and philanthropist.

Quote: The dog is a gentleman; I hope to go to his heaven not man's.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.

Quote: If you can't make it good, at least make it look good.
Author: Bill Gates

Quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
Author: Marilyn vos Savant

Quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
Author: Alice Walker

Quote: Winning takes talent; to repeat takes character.
Author: John Wooden

Author: Conrad Hall

Quote: Women are made to be loved, not understood.

Quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
Author: Thomas A. Edison

Quote: A mother's love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no law, no pity, it dares all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.
Author: W. E. B. Du Bois

Quote: One of the most tragic things I know about human nature is that all of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.

Quote: Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you.

Quote: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.

Quote: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.

Quote: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
Author: Margaret Walker

Author: T. Harv Eker

Author: Jim Valvano

Quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a week of work.
Author: John Lubbock, 1st Baron Avebury

Quote: I used to think the worst thing in life was to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone.

Quote: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.

April 2] 1743 – July 4, 1826) was a statesman, diplomat, architect, and Founding Father who served as the third president of the United States from 1801 to 1809. Quote: A failure is not always a mistake, it may simply be the best one can do under the circumstances. The real mistake is to stop trying.

Quote: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
Authors_info: Martin Luther King Jr. (January 15, 1929 – April 4, 1968) was an American Baptist minister and activist who became the most visible spokesperson and leader in the civil rights movement from 1954 until his assassination in 1968. Born in Atlanta, King is best known for advancing civil rights through nonviolence and civil disobedience, tactics his Christian beliefs and the nonviolent activism of Mahatma Gandhi helped inspire.

Quote: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.
Author: Rose Kennedy
Authors_info: Rose Elizabeth Fitzgerald Kennedy, Countess Kennedy (July 22, 1890 – January 22, 1995) was an American philanthropist, socialite, and the matriarch of the Kennedy family.

Quote: Whatever you want to do, do it now. There are only so many tomorrows.
Author: Michael Landon
Authors_info: Michael Landon (born Eugene Maurice Orowitz; October 31, 1936 – July 1, 1991) was an American actor, writer, director, and producer.

Quote: be yourself- not your idea of what you think somebody else's idea of yourself should be.
Author: Henry David Thoreau
Authors_info: Henry David Thoreau (see name pronunciation; July 12, 1817 – May 6, 1862) was an American essayist, poet, philosopher, abolitionist, naturalist, tax resister, development critic, surveyor, and historian.

Quote: Potentially, a government is the most dangerous threat to man's rights: it holds a legal monopoly on the use of physical force against legally disarmed victims.
Author: Ayn Rand
Authors_info: Ayn Rand (; born Alisa Zinovyevna Rosenbaum; February 2 [O.S. January 20] 1905 – March 6, 1982) was a Russian-American writer and philosopher.

Quote: If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die.
Author: William Shakespeare
Authors_info: William Shakespeare (bapt. 26 April 1564 – 23 April 1616) was an English poet, playwright and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language and the world's greatest dramatist.

Quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.
Authors_info: Martin Luther King Jr. (January 15, 1929 – April 4, 1968) was an American Baptist minister and activist who became the most visible spokesperson and leader in the civil rights movement from 1954 until his assassination in 1968. Born in Atlanta, King is best known for advancing civil rights through nonviolence and civil disobedience, tactics his Christian beliefs and the nonviolent activism of Mahatma Gandhi helped inspire.

Quote: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.
Author: Will Smith
Authors_info: Willard Carroll  Smith II  (born September 25, 1968) is an American actor and rapper. In April 2007, Newsweek called him "the most powerful actor in Hollywood".

Quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
Author: Woody Allen
Authors_info: Heywood "Woody" Allen  (born Allan Stewart Konigsberg; December 1, 1935) is an American director, writer, actor, and comedian whose career spans more than six decades.

Quote: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time; what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
Author: Sydney J. Harris
Authors_info: Sydney J. Harris (September 14, 1917 – December 7, 1986) was an American journalist for the Chicago Daily News and, later, the Chicago Sun-Times.

Quote: If you believe you can, you probably can. If you believe you won't, you most assuredly won't.Belief is the ignition switch that gets you off the launching pad.
Author: Denis Waitley
Authors_info: Denis E. Waitley (born 1933), is an American motivational speaker, writer and consultant. He has been recognized as the best-selling author of the audio series, The Psychology of Winning and books such as "Seeds of Greatness" and "The Winner's Edge".

Quote: Marriage: If you want something to last forever, you treat it differently. You shield it and protect it. You never abuse it. You don't expose it to the elements. You don't make it common or ordinary. If it ever becomes tarnished, you lovingly polish it until it gleams like new. It becomes special because you have made it so, and it grows more beautiful and precious as time goes by.
Author: F. Burton Howard

Quote: It's easy to make a buck. It's a lot tougher to make a difference.
Author: Tom Brokaw
Authors_info: Thomas John Brokaw (; born February 6, 1940) is an American television journalist and author, best known for being the anchor and managing editor of NBC Nightly News for 22 years (1982–2004).

Quote: A hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles.
Author: Christopher Reeve
Authors_info: Christopher D'Olier Reeve (September 25, 1952 – October 10, 2004) was an American actor best known for his motion picture portrayal of the classic DC comic book superhero Superman, beginning with the acclaimed Superman (1978), for which he won a BAFTA Award.

Quote: Ever since I was a child I have had this instinctive urge for expansion and growth. To me, the function and duty of a quality human being is the sincere and honest development of one's potential.
Author: Bruce Lee
Authors_info: Lee Jun-fan (Chinese: 李振藩; November 27, 1940 – July 20, 1973), known professionally as Bruce Lee (Chinese: 李小龍), was a Hong Kong-American actor, director, martial artist, martial arts instructor, and philosopher.

Quote: If you focus on results, you will never change. If you focus on change, you will get results.
Author: Jack Dixon
Authors_info: Jack Dixon (born 13 December 1994) is a Welsh rugby union player who plays for Dragons regional team having previously played for Bedwas RFC and Newport RFC.

Quote: To find joy in work is to discover the fountain of youth.
Author: Pearl S. Buck
Authors_info: Pearl Sydenstricker Buck (June 26, 1892 – March 6, 1973; also known by her Chinese name Sai Zhenzhu; Chinese: 賽珍珠) was an American writer and novelist.

Quote: Expect great things from God, attempt great things for God.
Author: William Carey
Authors_info: William or Bill Carey may refer to:

Quote: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
Author: Albert Einstein
Authors_info: Albert Einstein (; German: [ˈalbɛɐ̯t ˈʔaɪnʃtaɪn] (listen); 14 March 1879 – 18 April 1955) was a German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics (alongside quantum mechanics).

Quote: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.
Author: John C. Maxwell
Authors_info: John Calvin Maxwell (born 1947) is an American author, speaker, and pastor who has written many books, primarily focusing on leadership.

Quote: I mean, if the relationship can't survive the long term, why on earth would it be worth my time and energy for the short term?
Author: Nicholas Sparks
Authors_info: Nicholas Charles Sparks (born December 31, 1965) is an American romance novelist and screenwriter. He has published twenty novels and two non-fiction books.

Quote: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
Author: Steve Jobs
Authors_info: Steven Paul Jobs (; February 24, 1955 – October 5, 2011) was an American business magnate and investor.

Quote: Hating people is like burning down your own house to get rid of a rat.
Author: Harry Emerson Fosdick
Authors_info: Harry Emerson Fosdick (May 24, 1878 – October 5, 1969) was an American pastor.  Fosdick became a central figure in the "Fundamentalist–Modernist Controversy" within American Protestantism in the 1920s and 1930s and was one of the most prominent liberal ministers of the early 20th century.

Quote: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
Author: Golda Meir
Authors_info: Golda Meir (Hebrew: גּוֹלְדָּה מֵאִיר‬; pronounced [ˈɡolda meˈʔiʁ], born Golda Mabovitch, May 3, 1898 – December 8, 1978) was an Israeli teacher, kibbutznik, stateswoman, politician and the fourth prime minister of Israel.

Quote: If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of me.
Author: Dwight L. Moody
Authors_info: Dwight Lyman Moody (February 5, 1837 – December 22, 1899), also known as D. L. Moody, was an American evangelist and publisher connected with the Holiness Movement, who founded the Moody Church, Northfield School and Mount Hermon School in Massachusetts (now Northfield Mount Hermon School), Moody Bible Institute and Moody Publishers.

Quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
Author: Bill Gates
Authors_info: William Henry Gates III  (born October 28, 1955) is an American business magnate, investor, author, philanthropist, and humanitarian.

Quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
Author: Joseph Campbell
Authors_info: Joseph John Campbell (1904–1987) was an American Professor of Literature at Sarah Lawrence College who worked in comparative mythology and comparative religion.

Quote: A good friend is a connection to life - a tie to the past, a road to the future, the key to sanity in a totally insane world.
Author: Lois Wyse
Authors_info: Lois Wyse (October 30, 1926 – July 6, 2007) was an American advertising executive, author and columnist.

Quote: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
Author: Ambrose Bierce
Authors_info: Ambrose Gwinnett Bierce (June 24, 1842 – circa 1914) was an American short story writer, journalist, poet, and Civil War veteran.

Quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: Neither a wise man nor a brave man lies down on the tracks of history to wait for the train of the future to run over him.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Authors_info: Dwight David "Ike" Eisenhower ( EYE-zən-how-ər; October 14, 1890 – March 28, 1969) was an American army general and statesman who served as the 34th president of the United States from 1953 to 1961. During World War II, he was a five-star general in the United States Army and served as supreme commander of the Allied Expeditionary Forces in Europe.

Quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Authors_info: Ernest Miller Hemingway (July 21, 1899 – July 2, 1961) was an American journalist, novelist, and short-story writer.

Quote: Dream and give yourself permission to envision a You that you choose to be.
Author: Joy Page
Authors_info: Joy Page (November 9, 1924 – April 18, 2008) was an American actress best known for her role as the Bulgarian refugee Annina Brandel in Casablanca (1942).

Quote: Anybody can become angry - that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way - that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.
Author: Aristotle
Authors_info: Aristotle (;Greek: Ἀριστοτέλης Aristotélēs,pronounced [ aristotélɛːs ]; 384–322 BC) was an ancient Greek philosopher and scientist born in the city of Stagira, Chalkidiki, Greece.

Quote: Live out of your imagination, not your history.
Author: Stephen Covey
Authors_info: Stephen Richards Covey (October 24, 1932 – July 16, 2012) was an American educator, author, businessman, and keynote speaker.

Quote: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life.
Author: Golda Meir
Authors_info: Golda Meir (Hebrew: גּוֹלְדָּה מֵאִיר‬; pronounced [ˈɡolda meˈʔiʁ], born Golda Mabovitch, May 3, 1898 – December 8, 1978) was an Israeli teacher, kibbutznik, stateswoman, politician and the fourth prime minister of Israel.

Quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit; Genius hits a target no one else can see.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Authors_info: Arthur Schopenhauer ( SHOH-pən-how-ər; German: [ˈʔaɐ̯tʊɐ̯ ˈʃoːpm̩ˌhaʊ̯ɐ]; 22 February 1788 – 21 September 1860) was a German philosopher.

Quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
Author: Lucille Ball
Authors_info: Lucille Désirée Ball (August 6, 1911 – April 26, 1989) was an American actress, comedian, model, entertainment studio executive and producer.

Quote: Success is peace of mind which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you did your best to become the best you are capable of becoming.
Author: John Wooden
Authors_info: John Robert Wooden (October 14, 1910 – June 4, 2010) was an American basketball player and head coach at the University of California, Los Angeles.

Quote: Great achievement is usually born of great sacrifice, and is never the result of selfishness.
Author: Napoleon Hill
Authors_info: Oliver Napoleon Hill (born October 26, 1883 – November 8, 1970) was an American self-help author. He is known best for his book Think and Grow Rich (1937) which is among the 10 best selling self-help books of all time.

Quote: The connections between and among women are the most feared, the most problematic, and the most potentially transforming force on the planet.
Author: Adrienne Rich
Authors_info: Adrienne Cecile Rich (; May 16, 1929 – March 27, 2012) was an American poet, essayist and feminist. She was called "one of the most widely read and influential poets of the second half of the 20th century", and was credited with bringing "the oppression of women and lesbians to the forefront of poetic discourse."Her first collection of poetry, A Change of World, was selected by renowned poet W. H.

Quote: There are only two options regarding commitment; you’re either in or you’re out.
Author: Pat Riley
Authors_info: Patrick James Riley (born March 20, 1945) is an American professional basketball executive, and a former coach and player in the National Basketball Association (NBA).

Quote: Being ignorant is not so much a shame, as being unwilling to learn.
Author: Benjamin Franklin
Authors_info: Benjamin Franklin  (January 17, 1706 [O.S. January 6, 1705] –  April 17, 1790) was an American polymath and one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.

Quote: Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim.
Author: Nora Ephron
Authors_info: Nora Ephron ( EF-rən; May 19, 1941 – June 26, 2012) was an American journalist, writer, and filmmaker.

Quote: Don't let the fear of striking out hold you back.
Author: Babe Ruth
Authors_info: George Herman "Babe" Ruth Jr. (February 6, 1895 – August 16, 1948) was an American professional baseball player whose career in Major League Baseball (MLB) spanned 22 seasons, from 1914 through 1935. Nicknamed "The Bambino" and "The Sultan of Swat", he began his MLB career as a stellar left-handed pitcher for the Boston Red Sox, but achieved his greatest fame as a slugging outfielder for the New York Yankees.

Quote: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.
Author: Peter Drucker
Authors_info: Peter Ferdinand Drucker (; German: [ˈdʀʊkɐ]; November 19, 1909 – November 11, 2005) was an Austrian-born American management consultant, educator, and author, whose writings contributed to the philosophical and practical foundations of the modern business corporation.

Quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
Author: Will Rogers
Authors_info: William Penn Adair Rogers (November 4, 1879 – August 15, 1935) was an American stage and motion picture actor, vaudeville performer, American cowboy, humorist, newspaper columnist, and social commentator from Oklahoma.

Quote: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm, you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
Author: Morris West
Authors_info: Morris Langlo West AO (26 April 1916 – 9 October 1999) was an Australian novelist and playwright, best known for his novels The Devil's Advocate (1959), The Shoes of the Fisherman (1963) and The Clowns of God (1981).

Quote: If you want your children to improve, let them overhear the nice things you say about them to others.
Author: Haim Ginott
Authors_info: Haim G. Ginott (originally Ginzburg; 5 August 1922 – 4 November 1973) was a school teacher, a child psychologist and psychotherapist and a parent educator.

Quote: Start where you are, use what you have.
Author: Arthur Ashe
Authors_info: Arthur Robert Ashe Jr. (July 10, 1943 – February 6, 1993) was an American professional tennis player who won three Grand Slam titles.

Quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
Author: Helen Keller
Authors_info: Helen Adams Keller (June 27, 1880 – June 1, 1968) was an American author, political activist, and lecturer.

Quote: Many marriages would be better if the husband and the wife clearly understood that they are on the same side.
Author: Zig Ziglar
Authors_info: Hilary Hinton "Zig" Ziglar (November 6, 1926 – November 28, 2012) was an American author, salesman, and motivational speaker.

Quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
Author: Anne Frank
Authors_info: Annelies Marie Frank (German: [anəliːs maˈʁiː ˈʔanə ˈfʁaŋk]; Dutch: [ɑnəˈlis maːˈri ˈʔɑnə ˈfrɑŋk]; 12 June 1929 – February or March 1945) was a German-born Jewish diarist.

Quote: Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.
Author: Joyce Brothers
Authors_info: Joyce Diane Brothers (née Bauer; October 20, 1927 – May 13, 2013) was an American psychologist, television personality and columnist, who wrote a daily newspaper advice column from 1960 to 2013. In 1955, she became the only woman ever to win the top prize on the American game show The $64,000 Question, answering questions on the topic of boxing, which was suggested as a stunt by the show's producers.

Quote: You must either modify your dreams or magnify your skills
Author: Jim Rohn
Authors_info: Emanuel James "Jim" Rohn (September 17, 1930 – December 5, 2009) was an American entrepreneur, author and motivational speaker.

Quote: It's difficult to think anything but pleasant thoughts while eating a homegrown tomato.
Author: Lewis Grizzard
Authors_info: Lewis McDonald Grizzard Jr. (October 20, 1946 – March 20, 1994) was an American writer and humorist, known for his Southern demeanor and commentary on the American South.

Quote: I would rather have a mind opened by wonder than one closed by belief.
Author: Gerry Spence
Authors_info: Gerald Leonard "Gerry" Spence (born January 8, 1929) is a semi-retired American trial lawyer. He is a member of the American Trial Lawyers Hall of Fame.

Quote: I knew what my job was; it was to go out and meet the people and love them.
Author: Princess Diana

Quote: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.
Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
Authors_info: Frances Eliza Hodgson Burnett (24 November 1849 – 29 October 1924) was a British-born American novelist and playwright.

Quote: To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities.
Author: Bruce Lee
Authors_info: Lee Jun-fan (Chinese: 李振藩; November 27, 1940 – July 20, 1973), known professionally as Bruce Lee (Chinese: 李小龍), was a Hong Kong-American actor, director, martial artist, martial arts instructor, and philosopher.

Quote: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
Author: Winston Churchill
Authors_info: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill  (30 November 1874 – 24 January 1965) was a British politician, army officer, and writer, who was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1940 to 1945 and again from 1951 to 1955. As Prime Minister, Churchill led Britain to victory in Europe in the Second World War.

Quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation - we are challenged to change ourselves.
Author: Viktor E. Frankl

Quote: Education is for improving the lives of others and for leaving your community and world better than you found it.
Author: Marian Wright Edelman
Authors_info: Marian Wright Edelman (born June 6, 1939) is an American activist for the rights of children. She has been an advocate for disadvantaged Americans for her entire professional life.

Quote: A person who is nice to you, but rude to the waiter, is not a nice person.
Author: Dave Barry
Authors_info: David McAlister Barry (born July 3, 1947) is an American author and columnist who wrote a nationally syndicated humor column for the Miami Herald from 1983 to 2005. He has also written numerous books of humor and parody, as well as comic novels.

Quote: There is no death, only a change of worlds.
Author: Chief Seattle
Authors_info: Chief Seattle (c. 1786 – June 7, 1866) was a Suquamish and Duwamish chief. A leading figure among his people, he pursued a path of accommodation to white settlers, forming a personal relationship with "Doc" Maynard.

Quote: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.
Author: Jim Rohn
Authors_info: Emanuel James "Jim" Rohn (September 17, 1930 – December 5, 2009) was an American entrepreneur, author and motivational speaker.

Quote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
Author: Florence Nightingale
Authors_info: Florence Nightingale,  (; 12 May 1820 – 13 August 1910) was an English social reformer and statistician, and the founder of modern nursing.

Quote: If there must be trouble, let it be in my day, that my child may have peace.
Author: Thomas Paine
Authors_info: Thomas Paine (born Thomas Pain) (February 9, 1737 [O.S. January 29, 1736]  – June 8, 1809) was an English-born American political activist, philosopher, political theorist and revolutionary.

Quote: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear; knowing what must be done does away with fear.
Author: Rosa Parks
Authors_info: Rosa Louise McCauley Parks (February 4, 1913 – October 24, 2005) was an American activist in the civil rights movement best known for her pivotal role in the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

Quote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature.
Author: Helen Keller
Authors_info: Helen Adams Keller (June 27, 1880 – June 1, 1968) was an American author, political activist, and lecturer.

Quote: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
Author: Pablo Picasso
Authors_info: Pablo Ruiz Picasso (; Spanish: [ˈpaβlo piˈkaso]; 25 October 1881 – 8 April 1973) was a Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, stage designer, poet and playwright who spent most of his adult life in France.

Quote: If you're offered a seat on a rocket ship, don't ask what seat! Just get on.
Author: Sheryl Sandberg
Authors_info: Sheryl Kara Sandberg (born August 28, 1969) is an American technology executive, activist, author, and billionaire.

Quote: The beautiful thing about learning is nobody can take it away from you.
Author: B. B. King

Quote: Don't be distracted by criticism. Remember ~ the only taste of success some people have is when they take a bite out of you.
Author: Zig Ziglar
Authors_info: Hilary Hinton "Zig" Ziglar (November 6, 1926 – November 28, 2012) was an American author, salesman, and motivational speaker.

Quote: It's not your job to like me - it's mine
Author: Byron Katie
Authors_info: Byron Kathleen Mitchell, better known as Byron Katie (born December 6, 1942) is an American speaker and author who teaches a method of self-inquiry known as "The Work of Byron Katie" or simply as "The Work".

Quote: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
Author: Abraham Lincoln
Authors_info: Abraham Lincoln (February 12, 1809 – April 15, 1865) was an American lawyer and politician. He served as the 16th president of the United States from 1861 until his assassination in April 1865. Lincoln led the nation through the Civil War, its bloodiest war and its greatest moral, constitutional, and political crisis.

Quote: Aging is not "lost youth" but a new stage of opportunity and strength.
Author: Betty Friedan
Authors_info: Betty Friedan ( February 4, 1921 – February 4, 2006) was an American feminist writer and activist. A leading figure in the women's movement in the United States, her 1963 book The Feminine Mystique is often credited with sparking the second wave of American feminism in the 20th century.

Quote: We gain strength, and courage, and confidence by each experience in which we really stop to look fear in the face... we must do that which we think we cannot.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Authors_info: Anna Eleanor Roosevelt (; October 11, 1884 – November 7, 1962) was an American political figure, diplomat and activist.

Quote: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
Author: Melody Beattie
Authors_info: Melody Beattie is an American author of self-help books on codependent relationships.

Quote: Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Authors_info: Theodore  Roosevelt Jr. ( ROH-zə-velt; October 27, 1858 – January 6, 1919) was an American statesman, conservationist and writer who served as the 26th president of the United States from 1901 to 1909. He previously served as the 25th vice president of the United States from March to September 1901 and as the 33rd governor of New York from 1899 to 1900. As a leader of the Republican Party during this time, he became a driving force for the Progressive Era in the United States in the early 20th century.

Quote: It is better to look ahead and prepare than to look back and regret.
Author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee
Authors_info: Jacqueline "Jackie" Joyner-Kersee (born March 3, 1962) is an American retired track and field athlete, ranked among the all-time greatest athletes in the heptathlon as well as  long jump.

Quote: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
Author: Bob Marley
Authors_info: Robert Nesta Marley, OM (6 February 1945 – 11 May  1981) was a Jamaican singer-songwriter who became an international musical and cultural icon, blending mostly reggae, ska, and rocksteady in his compositions.

Quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Authors_info: Ernest Miller Hemingway (July 21, 1899 – July 2, 1961) was an American journalist, novelist, and short-story writer.

Quote: Fame is a vapor, popularity an accident, and riches take wings. Only one thing endures and that is character.
Author: Horace Greeley
Authors_info: Horace Greeley (February 3, 1811 – November 29, 1872) was an American author and statesman who was the founder and editor of the New-York Tribune, among the great newspapers of its time.

Quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
Author: Brian Tracy
Authors_info: Brian Tracy (born January 5, 1944) is a Canadian-American motivational public speaker and self-development author.

Quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
Author: Vince Lombardi
Authors_info: Vincent Thomas Lombardi (June 11, 1913 – September 3, 1970) was an American football player, coach, and executive in the National Football League (NFL).

Quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
Author: Muhammad Ali
Authors_info: Muhammad Ali (; born Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr.; January 17, 1942 – June 3, 2016) was an American professional boxer, activist, and philanthropist.

Quote: For every failure, there's an alternative course of action. You just have to find it. When you come to a roadblock, take a detour.
Author: Mary Kay Ash
Authors_info: Mary Kay Ash (May 12, 1918 – November 22, 2001) was an American businesswoman and founder of Mary Kay Cosmetics, Inc.

Quote: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.
Author: Irving Berlin
Authors_info: Irving Berlin (born Israel Beilin (Russian: Израиль Моисеевич Бейлин) May 23 [O.S. May 11] 1888 – September 22, 1989) was an American composer and lyricist, widely considered one of the greatest songwriters in American history.

Quote: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
Author: Paul Valery
Authors_info: Ambroise Paul Toussaint Jules Valéry (French: [pɔl valeʁi]; 30 October 1871 – 20 July 1945) was a French poet, essayist, and philosopher.

Quote: My heroes are the ones who survived doing it wrong, who made mistakes, but recovered from them.
Author: Bono
Authors_info: The bonobo (; Pan paniscus), also historically called the pygmy chimpanzee and less often, the dwarf or gracile chimpanzee, is an endangered great ape and one of the two species making up the genus Pan; the other being the common chimpanzee (Pan troglodytes).

Quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
Author: William Arthur Ward
Authors_info: William Arthur Ward (December 17, 1921–March 30, 1994) was an often quoted writer of inspirational maxims.More than 100 articles, poems and meditations written by Ward were published in such magazines as Reader's Digest, The Phi Delta Kappan, Science of Mind, and various Christian publications.

Quote: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
Author: Peter Marshall
Authors_info: Peter Marshall may refer to:

Quote: Tis' better to live your own life imperfectly than to imitate someone else's perfectly.
Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Authors_info: Elizabeth M. Gilbert (born July 18, 1969) is an American author, essayist, short story writer, biographer, novelist, and memoirist.

Quote: A loving person lives in a loving world. A hostile person lives in a hostile world.
Author: Ken Keyes Jr.
Authors_info: Ken Keyes Jr. (January 19, 1921 – December 20, 1995) was an American personal growth author and lecturer, and the creator of the Living Love method, a self-help system.

Quote: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
Author: Jim Rohn
Authors_info: Emanuel James "Jim" Rohn (September 17, 1930 – December 5, 2009) was an American entrepreneur, author and motivational speaker.

Quote: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
Author: Tony Robbins
Authors_info: Anthony Jay Robbins (born Anthony J. Mahavoric; February 29, 1960) is an American author, entrepreneur, philanthropist and life coach.

Quote: There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.
Author: Stephen Covey
Authors_info: Stephen Richards Covey (October 24, 1932 – July 16, 2012) was an American educator, author, businessman, and keynote speaker.

Authors_info: James A. Baldwin (May 26, 1886 – August 2, 1964) was an American football player, track athlete, coach of football, basketball, and baseball, and college athletics administrator.

Quote: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight, for a very long time, of the shore.
Author: Andre Gide
Authors_info: André Paul Guillaume Gide (French: [ɑ̃dʁe pɔl ɡijom ʒid]; 22 November 1869 – 19 February 1951) was a French author and winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature (in 1947).

Quote: All things are difficult before they are easy.
Author: Thomas Fuller
Authors_info: Thomas Fuller (baptized 19 June 1608 – 16 August 1661) was an English churchman and historian. He is now remembered for his writings, particularly his Worthies of England, published in 1662 after his death.

Quote: Effort and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
Author: John F. Kennedy
Authors_info: John Fitzgerald "Jack" Kennedy (May 29, 1917 – November 22, 1963), commonly referred to by his initials JFK, was an American politician and journalist who served as the 35th president of the United States from January 1961 until his assassination in November 1963. He served at the height of the Cold War, and the majority of his presidency dealt with managing relations with the Soviet Union.

Quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful what we pretend to be.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Authors_info: Kurt Vonnegut Jr. (; November 11, 1922 – April 11, 2007) was an American writer. In a career spanning over 50 years, Vonnegut published 14 novels, three short story collections, five plays, and five works of non-fiction, with further collections being published after his death.

Quote: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Authors_info: Theodore  Roosevelt Jr. ( ROH-zə-velt; October 27, 1858 – January 6, 1919) was an American statesman, conservationist and writer who served as the 26th president of the United States from 1901 to 1909. He previously served as the 25th vice president of the United States from March to September 1901 and as the 33rd governor of New York from 1899 to 1900. As a leader of the Republican Party during this time, he became a driving force for the Progressive Era in the United States in the early 20th century.

Quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
Author: Anna Quindlen
Authors_info: Anna Marie Quindlen (born July 8, 1952) is an American author, journalist, and opinion columnist.

Quote: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
Author: Paul Tournier
Authors_info: Paul Tournier (12 May 1898 – 7 October 1986) was a Swiss physician and author who had acquired a worldwide audience for his work in pastoral counseling.

Quote: You were born to win, but to be a winner, you must plan to win, prepare to win, and expect to win.
Author: Zig Ziglar
Authors_info: Hilary Hinton "Zig" Ziglar (November 6, 1926 – November 28, 2012) was an American author, salesman, and motivational speaker.

Quote: Love is the ability and willingness to allow those that you care for to be what they choose for themselves without any insistence that they satisfy you.
Author: Wayne Dyer
Authors_info: Wayne Walter Dyer (May 10, 1940 – August 29, 2015) was an American self-help author and a motivational speaker.

Quote: Those who matter don't mind, and those who mind don't matter.
Author: Bernard Baruch
Authors_info: Bernard Mannes Baruch (; August 19, 1870 – June 20, 1965) was an American financier, stock investor, philanthropist, statesman, and political consultant.

Quote: Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.
Author: Paulo Coelho
Authors_info: Paulo Coelho de Souza (; Portuguese: [ˈpawlu kuˈeʎu]; born 24 August 1947) is a Brazilian lyricist and novelist.

Quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
Author: Maya Angelou
Authors_info: Maya Angelou ( (listen); born Marguerite Annie Johnson; April 4, 1928 – May 28, 2014) was an American poet, singer, memoirist, and civil rights activist.

Quote: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend.
Author: Melody Beattie
Authors_info: Melody Beattie is an American author of self-help books on codependent relationships.

Quote: I don't go by the rule book... I lead from the heart, not the head.
Author: Princess Diana

Quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
Author: Bernard Williams
Authors_info: Sir Bernard Arthur Owen Williams, FBA (21 September 1929 – 10 June 2003) was an English moral philosopher.

Quote: The more one judges, the less one loves.
Author: Honore de Balzac
Authors_info: Honoré de Balzac (; French: [ɔ.nɔ.ʁe d(ə) bal.zak], born Honoré Balzac, 20 May 1799 – 18 August 1850) was a French novelist and playwright.

Quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Authors_info: Ernest Miller Hemingway (July 21, 1899 – July 2, 1961) was an American journalist, novelist, and short-story writer.

Quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
Author: Joseph Campbell
Authors_info: Joseph John Campbell (1904–1987) was an American Professor of Literature at Sarah Lawrence College who worked in comparative mythology and comparative religion.

Quote: At the end of the day, all you can hope for is to go on. The older I get, the more I realize that just keeping on keeping on is what life's all about.
Author: Janis Ian
Tags: The End Of The Day, Goes On, Realizing
Authors_info: Janis Ian (born Janis Eddy Fink; April 7, 1951) is an American singer-songwriter who was most commercially successful in the 1960s and 1970s; her most widely recognized song, "At Seventeen", was released as a single from her 1975 album Between the Lines which reached number 1 on the Billboard chart.

Quote: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
Author: Wayne Dyer
Authors_info: Wayne Walter Dyer (May 10, 1940 – August 29, 2015) was an American self-help author and a motivational speaker.

Quote: I have witnessed the softening of the hardest of hearts by a simple smile.
Author: Goldie Hawn
Authors_info: Goldie Jeanne Hawn (born November 21, 1945) is an American actress, producer, and singer. She rose to fame on the NBC sketch comedy program Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In (1968–70), before going on to receive the Academy Award and Golden Globe Award for Best Supporting Actress for her performance in Cactus Flower (1969).

Quote: Expect trouble as an inevitable part of life and when it comes, hold your head high, look it squarely in the eye and say “I will be bigger than you. You cannot defeat me.” Then repeat to yourself the most comforting of all words , “This too shall pass.”
Author: Ann Landers

Quote: The only way to live is to accept each minute as an unrepeatable miracle, which is exactly what it is: a miracle and unrepeatable.
Author: Storm Jameson
Authors_info: Margaret Storm Jameson (8 January 1891 – 30 September 1986) was an English journalist and author, known for her novels and reviews.

Quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
Author: Wayne Dyer
Authors_info: Wayne Walter Dyer (May 10, 1940 – August 29, 2015) was an American self-help author and a motivational speaker.

Quote: We are all here for some special reason. Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.
Author: Robin Sharma
Authors_info: Robin Sharma is the Canadian writer of The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari book series.Sharma worked as a litigation lawyer until age 25, when he self-published MegaLiving (1994), a book on stress management and spirituality.

Quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
Author: Abraham Lincoln
Authors_info: Abraham Lincoln (February 12, 1809 – April 15, 1865) was an American lawyer and politician. He served as the 16th president of the United States from 1861 until his assassination in April 1865. Lincoln led the nation through the Civil War, its bloodiest war and its greatest moral, constitutional, and political crisis.

Quote: People become really quite remarkable when they start thinking that they can do things. When they believe in themselves they have the first secret of success.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale
Authors_info: Norman Vincent Peale (May 31, 1898 – December 24, 1993) was an American minister and author known for his work in popularizing the concept of positive thinking, especially through his best-selling book The Power of Positive Thinking.

Quote: The best way out is always through.
Author: Robert Frost
Authors_info: Robert Lee Frost (March 26, 1874 – January 29, 1963) was an American poet. His work was initially published in England before it was published in America.

Quote: I don't know what the future may hold, but I know who holds the future.
Author: Ralph Abernathy
Authors_info: Ralph David Abernathy Sr. (March 11, 1926 – April 17, 1990) was an American civil rights activist and Christian minister.

Quote: The elevator to success is out of order. You'll have to use the stairs... one step at a time.
Author: Joe Girard
Authors_info: Joseph Elliott Girardi (born October 14, 1964) is an American former professional baseball catcher and manager.

Quote: Always walk through life as if you have something new to learn, and you will.
Author: Vernon Howard
Authors_info: Vernon Linwood Howard (March 16, 1918 – August 23, 1992) was an American spiritual teacher, author, and philosopher.

Quote: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Authors_info: Ralph Waldo Emerson (May 25, 1803 – April 27, 1882) was an American essayist, lecturer, philosopher, and poet who led the transcendentalist movement of the mid-19th century.

Quote: Every time you don't follow your inner guidance, you feel a loss of energy, loss of power, a sense of spiritual deadness.
Author: Shakti Gawain
Authors_info: Shakti Gawain  (30 September 1948 – 11 November 2018) was a New Age and personal development author. Her books have sold over 10 million copies.

Quote: Believe in love. Believe in magic. Hell, believe in Santa Clause. Believe in others. Believe in yourself. Believe in your dreams. If you don't, who will?
Author: Jon Bon Jovi
Authors_info: John Francis Bongiovi Jr. (born March 2, 1962), known professionally as Jon Bon Jovi, is an American singer-songwriter, record producer, philanthropist, and actor.

Quote: I have a very strict gun control policy: if there's a gun around, I want to be in control of it.
Author: Clint Eastwood
Authors_info: Clinton Eastwood Jr. (born May 31, 1930) is an American actor, filmmaker, musician, and political figure.

Quote: Never mistake motion for action.
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Authors_info: Ernest Miller Hemingway (July 21, 1899 – July 2, 1961) was an American journalist, novelist, and short-story writer.

Quote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Authors_info: Kurt Vonnegut Jr. (; November 11, 1922 – April 11, 2007) was an American writer. In a career spanning over 50 years, Vonnegut published 14 novels, three short story collections, five plays, and five works of non-fiction, with further collections being published after his death.

Quote: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
Author: Wayne Dyer
Authors_info: Wayne Walter Dyer (May 10, 1940 – August 29, 2015) was an American self-help author and a motivational speaker.

Quote: Stay committed to your decisions, but stay flexible in your approach.
Author: Tony Robbins
Authors_info: Anthony Jay Robbins (born Anthony J. Mahavoric; February 29, 1960) is an American author, entrepreneur, philanthropist and life coach.

Quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
Author: Francis Bacon
Authors_info: Francis Bacon, 1st Viscount St Alban,  (; 22 January 1561 – 9 April 1626) was an English philosopher and statesman, who served as Attorney General and as Lord Chancellor of England.

Quote: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
Author: Naguib Mahfouz
Authors_info: Naguib Mahfouz (Egyptian Arabic: نجيب محفوظ‎ Nagīb Maḥfūẓ, IPA: [næˈɡiːb mɑħˈfuːzˤ]; December 11, 1911 – August 30, 2006) was an Egyptian writer who won the 1988 Nobel Prize for Literature.

Quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
Author: Henry David Thoreau
Authors_info: Henry David Thoreau (see name pronunciation; July 12, 1817 – May 6, 1862) was an American essayist, poet, philosopher, abolitionist, naturalist, tax resister, development critic, surveyor, and historian.

Quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
Author: Dale Carnegie
Authors_info: Dale Harbison Carnegie (; spelled Carnagey until c. 1922; November 24, 1888 – November 1, 1955) was an American writer and lecturer, and the developer of famous courses in self-improvement, salesmanship, corporate training, public speaking, and interpersonal skills.

Quote: The very purpose of Christ's coming into the world was that He might offer up His life as a sacrifice for the sins of men.  He came to die.  This is the heart of Christmas.
Author: Billy Graham
Authors_info: William Franklin Graham Jr. (November 7, 1918 – February 21, 2018)  was an American evangelist, a prominent evangelical Christian figure,  and an ordained Southern Baptist minister who became well-known internationally in the late 1940s.

Quote: You have to grow from the inside out. None can teach you, none can make you spiritual. There is no other teacher but your own soul.
Author: Swami Vivekananda
Authors_info: Swami Vivekananda  (Bengali: [ʃami bibekanɔndo] (listen); 12 January 1863 – 4 July 1902), born Narendranath Datta (Bengali: [nɔrendronatʰ dɔto]), was an Indian Hindu monk, a chief disciple of the 19th-century Indian mystic Ramakrishna.

Quote: God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.
Author: Billy Graham
Authors_info: William Franklin Graham Jr. (November 7, 1918 – February 21, 2018)  was an American evangelist, a prominent evangelical Christian figure,  and an ordained Southern Baptist minister who became well-known internationally in the late 1940s.

Quote: You can close your eyes to the things you don't want to see, but you can't close your heart to the things you don't want to feel.
Author: Johnny Depp
Authors_info: John Christopher Depp II (born June 9, 1963) is an American actor, producer and musician. He has been nominated for ten Golden Globe Awards, winning one for Best Actor for his performance of the title role in Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2008) and has been nominated for three Academy Awards for Best Actor, among other accolades.

Quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
Author: Alice Walker
Authors_info: Alice Walker (born February 9, 1944) is an American novelist, short story writer, poet, and activist. She wrote the novel The Color Purple (1982), for which she won the National Book Award for hardcover fiction, and the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction.

Quote: If you can believe it, the mind can achieve it.
Author: Ronnie Lott
Authors_info: Ronald Mandel Lott (born May 8, 1959) is a former American professional football player who was a cornerback, free safety, and strong safety in the National Football League (NFL) for fourteen seasons during the 1980s and 1990s.

Quote: I do believe we're all connected. I do believe in positive energy. I do believe in the power of prayer. I do believe in putting good out into the world. And I believe in taking care of each other.
Author: Harvey Fierstein
Authors_info: Harvey Forbes Fierstein ( FIRE-steen; born June 6, 1954) is an American actor, playwright, and voice actor.

Quote: Never dull your shine for somebody else.
Author: Tyra Banks
Authors_info: Tyra Lynne Banks (born December 4, 1973) is an American television personality, producer, businesswoman, actress, author, former model and occasional singer.

Quote: What we think or what we know or what we believe is in the end of little consequence. The only thing of consequence is what we do
Author: John Ruskin
Authors_info: John Ruskin (8 February 1819 – 20 January 1900) was the leading English art critic of the Victorian era, as well as an art patron, draughtsman, watercolourist, a prominent social thinker and philanthropist.

Quote: It can not be emphasized too strongly or too often that this great nation was founded, not by religionists, but by Christians, not on religions, but on the gospel of Jesus Christ!
Author: Unknown (mathematics)

Quote: To give thanks in solitude is enough. Thanksgiving has wings and goes where it must go. Your prayer knows much more about it than you do.
Author: Victor Hugo
Authors_info: Victor Marie Hugo (French: [viktɔʁ maʁi yɡo] (listen); 26 February 1802 – 22 May 1885) was a French poet, novelist, and dramatist of the Romantic movement.

Quote: Don't compare your life to others. You have no idea what they have been through.
Author: Sam Cawthorn
Authors_info: Samuel "Sam" Cawthorn (born 15 December 1979) is an Australian motivational speaker, success coach, self-help author and entrepreneur.

Quote: The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you.
Author: Rumi
Authors_info: Jalāl ad-Dīn Muhammad Rūmī (Persian: جلال‌الدین محمد رومی‎), also known as Jalāl ad-Dīn Muhammad Balkhī (جلال‌الدین محمد بلخى), Mevlânâ/Mawlānā (مولانا, "our master"), Mevlevî/Mawlawī (مولوی, "my master"), and more popularly simply as Rumi (30 September 1207 – 17 December 1273), was a 13th-century Persian poet, jurist, Islamic scholar, theologian, and Sufi mystic originally from Greater Khorasan.

Quote: Faith is the strength by which a shattered world shall emerge into the light.
Author: Helen Keller
Authors_info: Helen Adams Keller (June 27, 1880 – June 1, 1968) was an American author, political activist, and lecturer.

Quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
Author: Anton Chekhov
Authors_info: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (Russian: Антон Павлович Чехов, tr. Antón Pávlovič Čéhov, IPA: [ɐnˈton ˈpavɫəvʲɪtɕ ˈtɕɛxəf]; 29 January 1860 – 15 July 1904) was a Russian playwright and short-story writer, who is considered to be among the greatest writers of short fiction in history.

Quote: If you are losing faith in human nature, go out and watch a marathon.
Author: Kathrine Switzer
Authors_info: Kathrine Virginia "Kathy" Switzer (born January 5, 1947, in Amberg, Germany) is an American marathon runner, author, and television commentator.In 1967, she became the first woman to run the Boston Marathon as a numbered entrant.

Quote: I've read the last page of the Bible. It's all going to turn out all right.
Author: Billy Graham
Authors_info: William Franklin Graham Jr. (November 7, 1918 – February 21, 2018)  was an American evangelist, a prominent evangelical Christian figure,  and an ordained Southern Baptist minister who became well-known internationally in the late 1940s.

Quote: From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
Author: Arthur Ashe
Authors_info: Arthur Robert Ashe Jr. (July 10, 1943 – February 6, 1993) was an American professional tennis player who won three Grand Slam titles.

Quote: Just because Fate doesn't deal you the right cards, it doesn't mean you should give up. It just means you have to play the cards you get to their maximum potential.
Author: Les Brown
Authors_info: Les Brown may refer to:

Quote: Don't you ever let a soul in the world tell you that you can't be exactly who you are.
Author: Lady Gaga
Authors_info: Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta (born March 28, 1986), known professionally as Lady Gaga, is an American singer, songwriter, and actress.

Quote: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
Author: Thomas Jefferson
Authors_info: Thomas Jefferson (April 13, [O.S. April 2] 1743 – July 4, 1826) was a statesman, diplomat, architect, and Founding Father who served as the third president of the United States from 1801 to 1809. Previously, he had been elected the second vice president of the United States, serving under John Adams from 1797 to 1801. The principal author of the Declaration of Independence, Jefferson was a proponent of democracy, republicanism, and individual rights motivating American colonists to break from the Kingdom of Great Britain and form a new nation; he produced formative documents and decisions at both the state and national level.

Quote: We must overcome the notion that we must be regular... it robs you of the chance to be extraordinary and leads you to the mediocre.
Author: Uta Hagen
Authors_info: Uta Thyra Hagen (12 June 1919 – 14 January 2004) was an American actress and theatre practitioner. She originated the role of Martha in the 1962 Broadway premiere of Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?

Quote: Exercise is king. Nutrition is queen. Put them together and you've got a kingdom.
Author: Jack LaLanne
Authors_info: Francois Henri Jack LaLanne (pronounced /lə'leɪn/ "luh-layn" French /lalan/ "lah-lahn"; September 26, 1914 – January 23, 2011) was an American fitness, exercise, and nutrition expert and motivational speaker who is sometimes referred to as the "Godfather of Fitness" and the "First Fitness Superhero".

Quote: You have not lived today until you have done something for someone who can never repay you.
Author: John Bunyan
Authors_info: John Bunyan (; baptised November 30, 1628 – August 31, 1688) was an English writer and Puritan preacher best remembered as the author of the Christian allegory The Pilgrim's Progress.

Quote: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
Author: Stephen King
Authors_info: Stephen Edwin King (born September 21, 1947) is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, science fiction, and fantasy.

Quote: Watch your manner of speech if you wish to develop a peaceful state of mind. Start each day by affirming peaceful, contented and happy attitudes and your days will tend to be pleasant and successful.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale
Authors_info: Norman Vincent Peale (May 31, 1898 – December 24, 1993) was an American minister and author known for his work in popularizing the concept of positive thinking, especially through his best-selling book The Power of Positive Thinking.

Quote: When a person really desires something, all the universe conspires to help that person to realize his dream.
Author: Paulo Coelho
Authors_info: Paulo Coelho de Souza (; Portuguese: [ˈpawlu kuˈeʎu]; born 24 August 1947) is a Brazilian lyricist and novelist.

Quote: The brighter you are, the more you have to learn.
Author: Don Herold
Authors_info: Don Herold (July 9, 1889 – June 1, 1966) was an American humorist, writer, illustrator, and cartoonist who wrote and illustrated many books and was a contributor to national magazines.

Quote: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don't set any condition.
Author: Arthur Rubinstein
Authors_info: Arthur Rubinstein, KBE (Polish: Artur Rubinstein; 28 January 1887 – 20 December 1982) was a  Polish American classical pianist.

Quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Authors_info: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe (, German: [ˈjoːhan ˈvɔlfɡaŋ fɔn ˈɡøːtə] (listen); 28 August 1749 – 22 March 1832) was a German writer and statesman.

Quote: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
Author: Wayne Dyer
Authors_info: Wayne Walter Dyer (May 10, 1940 – August 29, 2015) was an American self-help author and a motivational speaker.

Quote: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
Author: Napoleon Hill
Authors_info: Oliver Napoleon Hill (born October 26, 1883 – November 8, 1970) was an American self-help author. He is known best for his book Think and Grow Rich (1937) which is among the 10 best selling self-help books of all time.

Quote: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
Author: Winston Churchill
Authors_info: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer-Churchill  (30 November 1874 – 24 January 1965) was a British politician, army officer, and writer, who was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1940 to 1945 and again from 1951 to 1955. As Prime Minister, Churchill led Britain to victory in Europe in the Second World War.

Quote: You're never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you're never as bad as they say when you lose.
Author: Lou Holtz
Authors_info: Louis Leo Holtz (born January 6, 1937) is a former American football player, coach, and analyst. He served as the head football coach at The College of William & Mary (1969–1971), North Carolina State University (1972–1975), the New York Jets (1976), the University of Arkansas (1977–1983), the University of Minnesota (1984–1985), the University of Notre Dame (1986–1996), and the University of South Carolina (1999–2004), compiling a career record of 249–132–7. Holtz's 1988 Notre Dame team went 12–0 with a victory in the Fiesta Bowl and was the consensus national champion.

Quote: Nothing is so permanent as a temporary government program.
Author: Milton Friedman
Authors_info: Milton Friedman (; July 31, 1912 – November 16, 2006) was an American economist who received the 1976 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences for his research on consumption analysis, monetary history and theory and the complexity of stabilization policy.

Quote: I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday.
Author: Abraham Lincoln
Authors_info: Abraham Lincoln (February 12, 1809 – April 15, 1865) was an American lawyer and politician. He served as the 16th president of the United States from 1861 until his assassination in April 1865. Lincoln led the nation through the Civil War, its bloodiest war and its greatest moral, constitutional, and political crisis.

Quote: Today, more than ever before, life must be characterized by a sense of Universal responsibility, not only nation to nation and human to human, but also human to other forms of life.
Author: Dalai Lama
Authors_info: Dalai Lama (UK: , US: ; Standard Tibetan: ཏཱ་ལའི་བླ་མ་, Tā la'i bla ma [táːlɛː láma]) is a title given by the Tibetan people for the foremost spiritual leader of the Gelug or "Yellow Hat" school of Tibetan Buddhism, the newest of the classical schools of Tibetan Buddhism.

Quote: We should certainly count our blessings, but we should also make our blessings count.
Author: Neal A. Maxwell
Authors_info: Neal Ash Maxwell (July 6, 1926 – July 21, 2004) was an American scholar, educator, and religious leader who served as a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS Church) from 1981 until his death.

Quote: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.
Author: Edward de Bono
Authors_info: Edward Charles Francis Publius de Bono (born 19 May 1933) is a Maltese physician, psychologist, philosopher, author, inventor and consultant.

Quote: As the family goes, so goes the nation and so goes the whole world in which we live.
Author: Pope John Paul II
Authors_info: Pope John Paul II (Latin: Ioannes Paulus II; Italian: Giovanni Paolo II; Polish: Jan Paweł II; born Karol Józef Wojtyła; [ˈkarɔl ˈjuzɛv vɔjˈtɨwa]; 18 May 1920 – 2 April 2005) was head of the Catholic Church and sovereign of the Vatican City State from 1978 to 2005.

Quote: Everyone has inside of him a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is!
Author: Anne Frank
Authors_info: Annelies Marie Frank (German: [anəliːs maˈʁiː ˈʔanə ˈfʁaŋk]; Dutch: [ɑnəˈlis maːˈri ˈʔɑnə ˈfrɑŋk]; 12 June 1929 – February or March 1945) was a German-born Jewish diarist.

Quote: If Tyranny and Oppression come to this land, it will be in the guise of fighting a foreign enemy.
Author: James Madison
Authors_info: James Madison Jr. (March 16, 1751 – June 28, 1836) was an American statesman and Founding Father who served as the fourth president of the United States from 1809 to 1817. He is hailed as the "Father of the Constitution" for his pivotal role in drafting and promoting the United States Constitution and the United States Bill of Rights.

Quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
Author: William James
Authors_info: William James (1842–1910) was an American philosopher and psychologist, and the first educator to offer a psychology course in the United States.

Quote: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings. Then you will forget your anger.
Author: Epictetus
Authors_info: Epictetus (; Greek: Ἐπίκτητος, Epíktētos; c. 55 – 135 AD) was a Greek Stoic philosopher. He was born a slave at Hierapolis, Phrygia (present day Pamukkale, Turkey) and lived in Rome until his banishment, when he went to Nicopolis in northwestern Greece for the rest of his life.

Quote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
Author: Galileo Galilei
Authors_info: Galileo Galilei (Italian: [ɡaliˈlɛːo ɡaliˈlɛi]; 15 February 1564 – 8 January 1642) was an Italian astronomer, physicist and engineer, sometimes described as a polymath.

Quote: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
Author: Thomas Fuller
Authors_info: Thomas Fuller (baptized 19 June 1608 – 16 August 1661) was an English churchman and historian. He is now remembered for his writings, particularly his Worthies of England, published in 1662 after his death.

Quote: Can anything be sadder than work left unfinished? Yes, work never begun.
